I have a quick question about your AngularJS style guide’s suggestion for services at: https://github.com/johnpapa/angularjs-styleguide#services

In your example, you use the revealing module pattern to expose the functions and data. This works fine, unless the reference of the data being revealed is changed. In that situation, a controller which may expose the service’s data for binding won’t reflect the change.

Here’s an example: http://jsfiddle.net/BrianVallelunga/cccmu6mb/

In my example, I can change a member of the service’s data just fine, but not completely replace the data object itself. If I need to swap out the data object itself from within the service, how do you recommend doing this?

I’m sure you’re busy, but thanks for any time you give on this. If this is a common problem, maybe it could be added to the style guide.
